body_html: @rmlarsen maybe long term solution to speed/correctness is to make gesdd available in TensorFlow? Either new implementation, or MKL version -- gesdd . There's also gesvd which may be more robust, but also takes 3x longer
body_text: @rmlarsen maybe long term solution to speed/correctness is to make gesdd available in TensorFlow? Either new implementation, or MKL version -- gesdd . There's also gesvd which may be more robust, but also takes 3x longer
body: @rmlarsen maybe long term solution to speed/correctness is to make gesdd available in TensorFlow? Either new implementation, or MKL version -- [gesdd](https://software.intel.com/en-us/mkl-developer-reference-fortran-gesdd?language=en) . There's also [gesvd](https://software.intel.com/en-us/mkl-developer-reference-c-gesvd) which may be more robust, but also takes 3x longer
